docs.snippet: Quarterback Matt Leinart, a free agent, signed with the Buffalo Bills to fill an immediate need at Buffalo’s injury-depleted quarterback position....
docs.lead_paragraph: Quarterback Matt Leinart, a free agent, signed with the Buffalo Bills to fill an immediate need at Buffalo’s injury-depleted quarterback position.
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; Buffalo Bills sign quarterback Matt Leinart; other football developments noted.

headline.main: Bills Sign Leinart To Address Urgent Need
headline.print_headline: Bills Sign Leinart To Address Urgent Need

docs.snippet: Once the face, voice and personality of the Jets, Rex Ryan now presents himself as a diminished version of the man who took over as coach before the 2009 season....
docs.lead_paragraph: Once the face, voice and personality of the Jets, Rex Ryan now presents himself as a diminished version of the man who took over as coach before the 2009 season.
docs.abstract: Ben Shpigel On Pro Football column says New York Jets coach Rex Ryan, once the face, voice and personality of the team, now presents himself as a diminished version of the man who took over before the 2009 season; holds quarterback Geno Smith's time to start will come, and Ryan may not be the one to decide when that is.

headline.main: An Injury Makes Clear a Shift in Power
headline.print_headline: An Injury Makes Clear A Shift in Power

docs.snippet: Stevie Brown, who had eight interceptions last season, made one against the Jets on Saturday night but tore the anterior cruciate ligament in his left knee on the play....
docs.lead_paragraph: Stevie Brown, who had eight interceptions last season, made one against the Jets on Saturday night but tore the anterior cruciate ligament in his left knee on the play.
docs.abstract: New York Giants confirm that safety Stevie Brown, who injured his left knee returing an interception against New York Jets, will miss the rest of the 2013 NFL season.

headline.main: Giants’ Brown, Surprise Safety of 2012, Is Lost for Season
headline.print_headline: Giants’ Brown, Surprise Safety of 2012, Is Lost for Season

docs.snippet: In a story Aug. 26 about a lawsuit filed over the death of college football player Derek Sheely, The Associated Press reported erroneously that Frostburg State University was named as a defendant. Members of the school's 2011 football staff are na...
docs.lead_paragraph: In a story Aug. 26 about a lawsuit filed over the death of college football player Derek Sheely, The Associated Press reported erroneously that Frostburg State University was named as a defendant. Members of the school's 2011 football staff are named as defendants, but not the university itself.

docs.snippet: A look back at the week in sports, from players battling for the ball to riding the lead in races....
docs.lead_paragraph: A look back at the week in sports, from players battling for the ball to riding the lead in races.

docs.snippet: Louisville’s willingness to play football games on Tuesday nights, at ESPN’s urging, began a turnaround that led to huge rewards for the university and the network....
docs.lead_paragraph: Louisville’s willingness to play football games on Tuesday nights, at ESPN’s urging, began a turnaround that led to huge rewards for the university and the network.
docs.abstract: Partnership between University of Louisville and ESPN has been boon for school over the past dozen years, fueling its campaign to rise above commuter-school roots to become a powerhouse in college sports; crucial element was Louisville's decision to begin playing football games on Tuesday nights, allowing it to become a mainstay in prime time (Series: Remote Control).

headline.main: At Louisville, Athletic Boom Is Rooted in ESPN Partnership

byline.original: By STEVE EDER, RICHARD SANDOMIR and JAMES ANDREW MILLER

docs.snippet: An Ohio grand jury is waiting on outside forensic work before resuming its investigation into a rape case that led to the conviction of two high school football players....
docs.lead_paragraph: An Ohio grand jury is waiting on outside forensic work before resuming its investigation into a rape case that led to the conviction of two high school football players.

headline.main: Grand Jury in Ohio Rape Case Awaits Forensic Work
headline.print_headline: Grand Jury in Ohio Rape Case Awaits Forensic Work

docs.snippet: MLB Advanced Media said it would like to distribute all sorts of live events in the future, some free to users and some on a subscription basis....
docs.lead_paragraph: MLB Advanced Media said it would like to distribute all sorts of live events in the future, some free to users and some on a subscription basis.
docs.abstract: MLB Advanced Media, digital media company of Major League Baseball, is branching out into licensing business; will acquire worldwide distribution rights for coming Global Citizen Festival concert in New York City's Central Park.

headline.main: M.L.B. Media Company Buys Rights to Live Concert
headline.print_headline: M.L.B. Media Company Buys Rights to Live Concert
